alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Arapahoe. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 146 and 151. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Landspout tornadoes can form with a developing thunderstorm before rain, hail, and even thunder is observed. Landspout tornadoes are not usually associated with a wall cloud and are often difficult to detect with weather radar. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
